case_vignette: A 5-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of early morning headaches for the past 6 months. During this period, he has had severe nausea and occasional episodes of vomiting. For the past month, he has had difficulty walking and intermittent double vision. He was born at term and has been healthy apart from an episode of sinusitis 8 months ago that resolved spontaneously. He is at the 60th percentile for height and 50th percentile for weight. His temperature is 37.1°C (98.8°F), pulse is 80/min, and blood pressure is 105/64 mm Hg. Examination shows normal muscle strength and 2+ deep tendon reflexes bilaterally. He has a broad-based gait and impaired tandem gait. Fundoscopy shows bilateral swelling of the optic disc. There is esotropia of the left eye.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing early morning headaches, severe nausea, and occasional episodes of vomiting.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For the past 6 months.
Do you have any other symptoms such as visual disturbances, balance problems, or weakness in your limbs?
Yes, for the past month, I've had difficulty walking, intermittent double vision, and a broad-based gait.
Have you had any previous medical issues or surgeries involving your brain or nervous system?
No, I have been healthy apart from an episode of sinusitis 8 months ago that resolved on its own.
Do you have a family history of neurological diseases, such as multiple sclerosis, or tumors?
I do not have any information about my family history of neurological diseases.
Have you observed any changes or worsening of symptoms when changing body positions, like lying down or standing up?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my symptoms with different body positions.
Final Diagnosis: Brain tumor
